alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:54PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Middlesex, east central King and Queen, northern Mathews and southern Lancaster Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Church View, or near Urbanna, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. The strong thunderstorms will be near... Urbanna and Saluda around 905 PM EDT. White Stone and Hartfield around 925 PM EDT. Deltaville and Blakes around 940 PM EDT. Gwynn around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Mollusk, Senora, Harmony Village, Bertrand, Grafton, Amburg, Millenbeck, Warner, Christ Church and Greys Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex
